{"step_by_step_thinking": "The dorsal column, also known as the dorsal column medial lemniscus (DCML) pathway, deals with the conscious appreciation of fine touch, two-point discrimination, conscious proprioception, and vibration sensations from the entire body except for the head. This means that it carries proprioception, vibration, and touch. However, it does not carry pain. Pain and temperature sensations are carried by the spinothalamic tract, not the dorsal column.", "answer_choice": "A"}
